Parts.Name: Part A - Operation as Inverting amplifier

Sections.File: src/labs/1. Operational Amplifier/Part A - Operation as Inverting amplifier/1.1 1kHz Gain.cir
Sections.Name: 1.1 1kHz Gain
Sections.Solution:
*
.SUBCKT LT1008 3 2 7 4 6 1 8
* USE C=30 PF IN MAIN CIRCUIT (CA TO CB).
* INPUT
RC1 7 80 8842
RC2 7 90 8842
Q1 80 2 10 QM1
Q2 90 3 11 QM2
DDM1 2 3 DM2
DDM2 3 2 DM2
C1 80 90 8.66e-12
RE1 10 12 224.6
RE2 11 12 224.6
IEE 12 4 6e-6
RE 12 0 33330000
CE 12 0 1.579E-12
* INTERMEDIATE
GCM 0 8 12 0 2.841E-11
GA 8 0 80 90 1.131E-04
R2 8 0 100000
* EXTERNAL COMP CAP USED FOR C2 (SEE NOTE ABOVE).
GB 1 0 8 0 196
* OUTPUT
RO1 1 6 100
RO2 1 0 900
RC 17 0 6.802e-5
GC 0 17 6 0 14700
D1 1 17 DM1
D2 17 1 DM1
D3 6 13 DM2
D4 14 6 DM2
VC 7 13 1.774
VE 14 4 1.774
IP 7 4 0.000374
DSUB 4 7 DM2
.MODEL QM1 NPN(IS=8e-16 BF=66670)
.MODEL QM2 NPN(IS=8.009E-16 BF=200000)
.MODEL DM1 D(IS=4.276E-12)
.MODEL DM2 D(IS=8e-16)
.ENDS LT1008
XU1 0 6 3 7 4 1 2 LT1008
V1 3 0 15
V2 0 7 15
V3 5 0 SINE(0 0.1 1k)
R1 4 6 50k
R2 6 5 1k
C1 0 0 30p
* INSTRUCTIONS: Check that your 1 kHz sinusoidal input voltage amplitude is below 100mV and the output voltage is also sinusoidal (not slew rate limited). Measure the gain.
* SIMULATION NOTES: For the purposes of simulation, set the amplitude of the input signal to exactly 100mV. The simulation time should be 2 milliseconds
* DIGOUTPUT0_PRE = 1 0 0 0 0 0 0 0
* DIGOUTPUT1_PRE = 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0
* DIGOUTPUT0_POST = 0 1 0 0 0 0 0 0
* DIGOUTPUT1_POST = 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0
* AOUTPUT0_PRE = 2.5
* AOUTPUT1_PRE = 0.0
* AOUTPUT0_POST = 3.3 
* AOUTPUT1_POST = 0.0 
.control
tran 5u 2m
run
print v(4) v(5)
.endc

Frequency Response

* INPUT

RE2 11 12 224.6

* INTERMEDIATE

* EXTERNAL COMP CAP USED FOR C2 (SEE NOTE ABOVE).

* OUTPUT

.MODEL QM1 NPN(IS=8e-16 BF=66670)
.MODEL QM2 NPN(IS=8.009E-16 BF=200000)
.MODEL DM1 D(IS=4.276E-12)
.MODEL DM2 D(IS=8e-16)

XU1 0 6 3 7 4 1 2 LT1008
V1 3 0 15
V2 0 7 15
V3 5 0 ac 1 dc 0
R1 4 6 50k
R2 6 5 1k
C1 0 0 30p
* INSTRUCTIONS: Determine the 3dB Bandwidth, of this circuit, and then the frequency at which the gain falls to 0dB. Finally, plot the phase frequency response
* SIMULATION NOTES: Perform a frequency sweep of the circuit given. This will require configuring the virtual oscilloscope. Run the sweep up to 1MHz with decade time steps and 1 step per decade.
* OUTPUT: 5 0 0 0 5 0 0 5
.control
ac dec 10 0.1 100T
run
print 20*log10(v(4))
.endc

* USE C=30 PF IN MAIN CIRCUIT (CA TO CB).

RC1 7 80 8842
RC2 7 90 8842
Q1 80 2 10 QM1
Q2 90 3 11 QM2
DDM1 2 3 DM2
DDM2 3 2 DM2
C1 80 90 8.66e-12
RE1 10 12 224.6

RE 12 0 33330000
CE 12 0 1.579E-12
* INTERMEDIATE
GCM 0 8 12 0 2.841E-11

GB 1 0 8 0 196

RO2 1 0 900
RC 17 0 6.802e-5
GC 0 17 6 0 14700
D1 1 17 DM1
D2 17 1 DM1
D3 6 13 DM2
D4 14 6 DM2
VC 7 13 1.774
VE 14 4 1.774
IP 7 4 0.000374
DSUB 4 7 DM2
.MODEL QM1 NPN(IS=8e-16 BF=66670)
.MODEL QM2 NPN(IS=8.009E-16 BF=200000)
.MODEL DM1 D(IS=4.276E-12)
.MODEL DM2 D(IS=8e-16)
.ENDS LT1008

run

.endc

Parts.Name: Part A - Differential Amplifier

Sections.File: src/labs/2. Amplifier with Feedback/Part A - Differential Amplifier/1.1 Measurement of DC Biasing.cir
Sections.Name: 1.1 Measurement of DC Biasing
Sections.Solution:
*
.SUBCKT LM741       1   2  99  50  28
*
*Features:
*Improved performance over industry standards
*Plug-in replacement for LM709,LM201,MC1439,748
*Input and output overload protection
*
****************INPUT STAGE**************
*
IOS 2 1 20N
*^Input offset current
R1 1 3 250K
R2 3 2 250K
I1 4 50 100U
R3 5 99 517
R4 6 99 517
Q1 5 2 4 QX
Q2 6 7 4 QX
*Fp2=2.55 MHz
C4 5 6 60.3614P
*
***********COMMON MODE EFFECT***********
*
I2 99 50 1.6MA
*^Quiescent supply current
EOS 7 1 POLY(1) 16 49 1E-3 1
*Input offset voltage.^
R8 99 49 40K
R9 49 50 40K
*
*********OUTPUT VOLTAGE LIMITING********
V2 99 8 1.63
D1 9 8 DX
D2 10 9 DX
V3 10 50 1.63
*
**************SECOND STAGE**************
*
EH 99 98 99 49 1
G1 98 9 5 6 2.1E-3
*Fp1=5 Hz
R5 98 9 95.493MEG
C3 98 9 333.33P
*
***************POLE STAGE***************
*
*Fp=30 MHz
G3 98 15 9 49 1E-6
R12 98 15 1MEG
C5 98 15 5.3052E-15
*
*********COMMON-MODE ZERO STAGE*********
*
*Fpcm=300 Hz
G4 98 16 3 49 3.1623E-8
L2 98 17 530.5M
R13 17 16 1K
*
**************OUTPUT STAGE**************
*
F6 50 99 POLY(1) V6 450U 1
E1 99 23 99 15 1
R16 24 23 25
D5 26 24 DX
V6 26 22 0.65V
R17 23 25 25
D6 25 27 DX
V7 22 27 0.65V
V5 22 21 0.18V
D4 21 15 DX
V4 20 22 0.18V
D3 15 20 DX
L3 22 28 100P
RL3 22 28 100K
*
***************MODELS USED**************
*
.MODEL DX D(IS=1E-15)
.MODEL QX NPN(BF=625)
*
.ENDS
RB 2 3 1k
Q4 3 3 4 QM1
C1 8 7 30p
RC1 5 7 1k
RC2 6 8 1k
R41 0 0 4k
R42 0 0 4k
R3 0 0 4k
R2 0 0 4k
R1 0 0 1k
V1 1 0 dc 1
V2 0 4 dc 1
RAmmeter1 1 2 1m
RAmmeter2 1 5 1m
RAmmeter3 1 6 1m
Q4 9 9 4 QM1
Q1 7 0 9 QM1
Q2 8 0 9 QM1
XU1 0 0 0 0 0 LM741
.MODEL QM1 NPN(IS=8e-16 BF=66670)
* INSTRUCTIONS: Check that your 1 kHz sinusoidal input voltage amplitude is below 100mV and the output voltage is also sinusoidal (not slew rate limited). Measure the gain.
* SIMULATION NOTES: For the purposes of simulation, set the amplitude of the input signal to exactly 100mV. The simulation time should be 2 milliseconds
* MULTIMETER
.control
dc V1 10 10 0.1
dc V2 10 10 0.1
run
print v(7) V(8) v(9) v(3) V(1,2)/1m V(1,5)/1m V(1,6)/1m
.endc
Sections.Instructions: Check that your 1 kHz sinusoidal input voltage amplitude is below 100mV and the output voltage is also sinusoidal (not slew rate limited). Measure the gain.
Sections.SimulationNotes: For the purposes of simulation, set the amplitude of the input signal to exactly 100mV. The simulation time should be 2 milliseconds

SimulationParams.raw:

dc V2 10 10 0.1
run
print v(7) V(8) v(9) v(3) V(1,2)/1m V(1,5)/1m V(1,6)/1m
.endc

*
R1 2 3 1k
Q1 3 3 4 QM1
C1 8 7 30p
R3 5 7 1k
R4 6 8 1k
V1 1 0 10
V2 0 4 10
RAmmeter1 1 2 1m
RAmmeter2 1 5 1m
RAmmeter3 1 6 1m
Q3 7 0 9 QM1
Q4 8 0 9 QM1
Q2 9 9 4 QM1
.MODEL QM1 NPN(IS=8e-16 BF=66670)
* INSTRUCTIONS: Check that your 1 kHz sinusoidal input voltage amplitude is below 100mV and the output voltage is also sinusoidal (not slew rate limited). Measure the gain.
* SIMULATION NOTES: For the purposes of simulation, set the amplitude of the input signal to exactly 100mV. The simulation time should be 2 milliseconds
* CODE: 111A
.control
.dc V1 10 10 0
.dc V2 10 10 0
run
print v(7) V(8) v(9) v(3)
.endc
